intro: Tacsonia × taylorii, commonly known as the hybrid Tacsonia, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, blooming in late spring to early summer. Tacsonia × taylorii thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
